channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Canada Post says layoffs aim to ‘align our management team' amid overhaul
item.description: The company said the changes 'will align with the government’s expectation that leadership and structural change from within the Corporation is essential.'
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Interior Health deals with 2 waves of resignations, BC Conservatives call for action
item.description: Health Minister Josie Osborne said the province is focused on supporting doctors and other health care professionals during a time of mounting pressure.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: First Nation and Canada begin legal battle over ‘grossly underfunded’ on-reserve schools
item.description: The Canadian Human Rights Tribunal has begun hearing a potentially precedent-setting legal battle between Canada and the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation about the alleged systemic underfunding of on-reserve schooling in Ontario.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Drug to slow early-stage Alzheimer's disease approved by Health Canada
item.description: Lecanemab is the first medication approved in Canada that targets the buildup of amyloid plaque in the brain, which is believed to be an underlying cause of Alzheimer's disease.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: People who lived at Ontario Training Schools seek closure 8 years after start of class action alleging abuse
item.description: People who lived at Ontario Training Schools are suing the province, alleging abuse was rampant at the children's detention centres. Nearly eight years after a class action was launched, the case is still stuck in the civil system. Lawyers say it’s another casualty of underfunded courts.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Governments Of Canada and Manitoba Strengthening Justice for Canada's First Responders
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canadian studies set to be conducted on ISS. What to know
item.description: The studies will examine such things as astronauts' mental health and how their bodies adapt to microgravity and cope with space anemia.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: As tastes change, Alberta’s craft brewers expand their offerings
item.description: According to Statistics Canada, beer consumption in Alberta has declined over the past decade. During the same time period, the market share of ciders, coolers and ready-to-drink cocktails has doubled.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Bank of Canada could cut rates again. It likely won't help food prices
item.description: As many Canadians struggle with affording essentials like food, experts say an interest rate cut by the Bank of Canada could help consumers, but not as much for grocery prices.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ford government to limit debate, skip public hearings on bill to scrap speed cameras
item.description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford's government is proposing to limit debate and avoid public input on three pieces of legislation, including one that would end the province's speed camera program.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How Canadian charities fund illegal West Bank settlements
item.description: An investigation from CBC's the fifth estate follows the trail of millions of dollars in tax-deductible donations sent through Canadian charities to support Israeli settlements deemed illegal under international law.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: As Carney set for key China talks, Poilievre urges ‘results' on tariffs
item.description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Canadians expect Prime Minister Mark Carney to get some results from his upcoming meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Expands Care for Dialysis Patients and Mothers in Norway House Cree Nation
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Could ‘Plan México’ be the guide for ‘Plan Canada’
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How Certified Canadian Publishers Keep Our Stories Close to Home
item.description: A new national program helps readers easily spot and support Canadian-owned book publishers.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carney mum on whether he saw Ontario's anti-tariff ad beforehand
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘Forever Canadian' petition surpasses goal, collects 456K signatures
item.description: The final tally is far greater than the required 294,000 signatures to initiate a possible referendum in Alberta.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Return to office for Ontario civil servants 'unnecessarily confusing,' unions say
item.description: The return to office last week by thousands of Ontario public servants has been "disrespectful,”  “piecemeal” and filled with “unnecessary confusion,” say the workers' unions, who point out some ministries and agencies still don't have enough space to meet Premier Doug Ford’s order.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: BC’s Government Employee Strike Is Over. Here’s What Comes Next
item.description: The tentative deal clears the way for other public sector unions to fight for better wages.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: N.B. business in trademark tangle with Alberta government over licence plates
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Say cheese? Why you'll soon have to take photos when entering, exiting U.S.
item.description: Travellers will soon be required to have their photograph taken when entering or leaving the U.S. by air, sea or land — including Canadians and even American citizens.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. sees 1st avian flu outbreaks since January as 9 confirmed in poultry stocks
item.description: A list published by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency shows the virus has been detected in nine commercial poultry flocks in the region over the last two weeks.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Beaches make a play for Canadian rock royalty at Doug Mitchell
item.description: The Beaches are making more than just waves.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Vancouver May Get a Major New City Plan. It’s Not Enough
item.description: Council will vote on an approach that assumes just building more will spur affordability, even though that’s not true.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: BC Residents May Have to Cover a Property Tax Break for Pipelines
item.description: After lobbying, BC Assessment slashed its appraisals of the industry’s infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Which industry in each province is most threatened by tariffs?
item.description: As tariffs make an impact, Canadian industries are finding themselves competing for priority in trade negotiations. Here are the industries under threat in each province.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: More Alberta parents pushing back against vitamin K injection for newborns, some doctors say
item.description: Some Alberta doctors say they're seeing a recent and concerning trend of new parents either questioning or refusing vitamin K injections, which have been given to newborns as standard practice for decades.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 86-year-old man with Alzheimer's walks out of Saskatoon care home undetected, dies days later
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Halloween costumes don't have to come from a store. Here are some tricks to make your own
item.description: Some people are trading in store-bought Halloween costumes for do-it-yourself options. Hot glue, dollar-store materials and items that can be found at home are all you need to create affordable, high-quality get-ups.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: AI 'hallucinations' could prove real problem for owner of fire-ravaged Vancouver property
item.description: As the owner of a fire-ravaged Vancouver property he's been accused of neglecting, Fu De Ren has defended himself in civil proceedings and bylaw trials. But his inclusion of alleged AI "hallucinations" as part of a self-represented bid to cut his property's assessed value in half may end up costing him money.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Arctic fossil is northern-most rhino species ever found
item.description: Millions of years ago, a pony-sized, hornless rhino wandered through the woods and munched on leaves in what is now northern Nunavut. A new study identities it as a new species, and offers an intriguing explanation for how it got there.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Calgary recount confirms Jeromy Farkas elected as mayor
item.description: On Tuesday, Elections Calgary released updated numbers, which show that Jeromy Farkas won the election with 91,112 votes to Sharp's 90,496, a difference of 616 votes.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
